reviews.review_msg: Just BRUTALLLLL. Holy lord, I took this class my first semester of university and it kind of put a giant shade of grey on the already cloudy sfu. I didn't learn much, my TA was sweet and what I did learn; I learned from her. JT does her entire lecture on an overhead through her computer, but she is completely computer illiterate. Poor. Dont do it.
Not a great prof by any means.
Do no take this course! Lectures are boring and useless.
Boring classes, class is full of wannabe poets. Do not take course. Id rather take women studies or first nation studies. I regret taking this course.

worst prof ever. boring lectures and useless notes. i think she is a good poet, but she just doesnt know how to teach. she says one word ummmmmmmmmmm next word ummmmmmmmm ... but fairy easy class. good TAs for sure.

Lectures are boring, do not take this course if you need a writing course, only take this course if you know you are good at writing papers. Expects you to remember all the poems read throughout the semester for the final. AVOID TAKING THIS COURSE UNLESS YOU HAVE TO!!

try to avoid taking poetry with her. Although she may be a good poet, she certainly CANNOT teach. She is very amateur and her lectures consists of her reading (and stuttering) directly off the slides. I still cannot understand how she became a professor at SFU
